title: 250th Anniversary of Patrick Henry's "Give Me Liberty, Or Give Me Death!" Speech
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump commemorating the 250th anniversary of Patrick Henry's "Give me Liberty, or give me death!" speech. Delivered on March 23, 1775, at St. John's Church in Richmond, Virginia, this address was pivotal in galvanizing support for American independence during a time of rising British tyranny. The proclamation emphasizes the significance of Henry's words in inspiring action among patriots and marks the resolution to form a militia as a crucial step toward independence.

The document reflects on Henry's legacy as a key figure in American history, highlighting his role as an advocate for liberty and the spirit of revolution. It calls for a revival of the courage and determination exemplified by Henry and his contemporaries to build a brighter future for the nation. The proclamation officially designates March 23, 2025, as a day of celebration in honor of Henry's impactful speech, reinforcing its enduring relevance in American ideals of freedom and independence.
